identificationModule.briefTitle: 24-Week Study to Assess the PD, Safety, Tolerability, and PK of GLM101 in Participants With PMM2-CDG
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase 2, Randomized, Open-Label, 24-Week Study to Assess the Pharmacodynamics, Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of Multiple Doses of GLM101 Administered Intravenously to Adult, Adolescent, and Pediatric Participants With PMM2-CDG

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is a Phase 2, randomized, open-label, 24-week treatment study to evaluate the potential pharmacodynamic (PD) activity, safety, tolerability, and pharmacokinetics (PK) of GLM101 in adult, adolescent, and pediatric, patients with a confirmed diagnosis of PMM2-CDG. The planned doses of GLM101 to be investigated are 10, 20 and 30 mg/kg. The study will consist of a Screening Period, a 24-week (6-month) Treatment Period, and a 30-day (1-month) Follow-Up Period.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Participants will randomized to receive either 10 mg/kg GLM101 or 20 mg/kg GLM101. Subsequently, if safety and tolerability are demonstrated at 10 and 20 mg/kg, 30 mg/kg groups will be added

primaryOutcomes.measure: Evaluate changes in coagulation and antithrombosis factors
primaryOutcomes.description: Changes in AT-III activity level and factor XI activity

primaryOutcomes.measure: Evaluate changes from baseline in ataxia
primaryOutcomes.description: Changes in ICARS (International Co-operative Ataxia Rating Scale)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Evaluation of Pharmacodynamic activity in blood biomarkers (glycomics, glycoproteomics, and transferrin isoform ratios)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of participants with treatment-emergent adverse events assessed by severity and frequency
secondaryOutcomes.description: Safety and tolerability of multiple doses of GLM101
Assessment of the pharmacokinetics (PK) of GLM101

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time to maximum observed plasma concentration (Tmax)
Area under the plasma concentration vs. time curve (AUC)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Assessment of the pharmacokinetics (PK) of GLM101

browseBranches.name: Diseases and Abnormalities at or Before Birth
